This Privacy Policy explains how TapNBite collects, uses, and protects your personal information

TapNBite collects seller data, such as menu information and sales records, to support efficient order processing and inventory management. This information is used exclusively within the platform to optimize app functionality and provide analytics for better service.

Seller data is encrypted and securely stored. Access to this data is limited to authorized personnel, and sellers are required to maintain the confidentiality of their login credentials. TapNBite ensures data privacy but encourages sellers to report any security concerns immediately.

Sales trends, menu availability, and inventory data are used to generate insights that help sellers improve service efficiency. Sellers can view and update this information through their dashboard. TapNBite does not share seller data externally unless legally mandated.

Sellers are responsible for adhering to TapNBite’s operational guidelines and applicable institutional policies. Any misuse of the platform or violations of these policies will result in an account review, and necessary actions may be taken to address non-compliance.

Welcome to TapNBite! By using the app, you agree to these Terms and Conditions. Please read them carefully to ensure a clear understanding of your rights and responsibilities while using the platform.

Canteen staff must register as sellers on TapNBite using verified credentials provided by their institution. Each seller is responsible for managing their account and ensuring proper use of the TapNBite dashboard.\n\nUnauthorized sharing of login credentials is prohibited and may result in account suspension.

Sellers are required to promptly prepare and manage orders as notified by the app. Updates to menu availability and inventory must be made in real time to avoid order discrepancies. TapNBite may penalize repeated instances of delayed or incorrect order fulfillment.

All transactions are processed using Pellets. Sellers must verify payment confirmation before marking orders as complete. Any disputes regarding payments or incomplete orders should be reported through TapNBite’s support system for resolution.

Sellers may adjust operating hours, menus, or pricing based on real-time conditions, such as supply shortages. However, users must be informed of any changes via the app to ensure transparency and maintain trust.
